intro: Euphrasia, commonly known as eyebright, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It consists of about 200 species, most of which are herbaceous plants native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have small, yellow or white flowers with distinctive spurred petals. They thrive in moist, shady environments and are often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Euphrasia species are known for their medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal medicine.
